project_name.justification: The project is consistently located in Railroad Valley, as stated in the headline: 'Canter Resources Acquires Railroad Valley Lithium-Boron Project'. The specific acquisition is referred to as the 'RV Project'.

company_name.justification: The authoritative company name is Canter Resources Corp., which is identified as the acquirer in the relevant news release: 'Canter Resources Corp. (CSE: CRC) (OTC Pink: CNRCF) (FSE: 601) ("Canter " or the "Company ") is pleased to report that it has acquired a prospective 1,000 acre property ("RV Project") in Railroad Valley...'

ceo_buyer.justification: The CEO of the acquiring company, Canter Resources Corp., is identified in the text: 'commented Canter CEO, Joness Lang.'

interest_acquired_percent.justification: Canter acquired a full interest in the claims as stated in the acquisition terms: '...entered into a Claims Acquisition Agreement with Ramp Metals USA Inc. to a 100% interest in 50 unpatented association placer claims in Railroad Valley...'

primary_commodity.justification: The authoritative primary commodity is Li. The project is described as a lithium project in the text: 'Canter Resources Acquires Railroad Valley Lithium-Boron Project'.

verified_article_link.justification: No article link was provided in the prompt.

currency.justification: The currency is specified as Canadian dollars for the share price and the NSR buyback option: '...with a deemed price of CAD$0.13...' and '...buy back the NSR for a one-time CAD$500,000 payment...'

cash_payments_raw.justification: The agreement mentions that 'Canter will pay transfer costs and reimburse recently paid BLM fees', but no specific cash amount for the acquisition itself is stated.

share_payments_raw.justification: The transaction terms are defined by the number of shares and a price per share, which are populated in their respective fields as per the extraction hierarchy. Therefore, this field is null.

cash_and_share_payments_combined_raw.justification: The transaction terms are defined by the number of shares and a price per share, which are populated in their respective fields as per the extraction hierarchy. Therefore, this field is null.

amount_of_shares_issued.justification: The acquisition terms state the number of shares to be issued: '300,000 Canter common shares ("Consideration Shares")...'

share_warrant_payments_raw.justification: No share warrants were mentioned as part of the acquisition terms.

option_payments_raw.justification: No options were mentioned as part of the acquisition terms.

issued_share_price.justification: The acquisition terms state the deemed price of the shares to be issued: '300,000 Canter common shares ("Consideration Shares") with a deemed price of CAD$0.13...'

exploration_commitment_meters.justification: No exploration commitment in meters was mentioned in the text.

exploration_commitment_value_raw.justification: The text mentions plans for future work ('Canter has compiled historical data and plans to complete follow up sampling at the RV Project... in Q4/2024') but does not state a specific monetary exploration commitment.

nsr_acquired_percent.justification: The seller retained a Net Smelter Royalty as part of the deal terms: 'Ramp Metals USA Inc. will retain a 0.5% NSR, with Canter having the ability to buy back the NSR for a one-time CAD$500,000 payment at any time.'

coverage_area_raw.justification: The size of the acquired property is stated in the text: '...it has acquired a prospective 1,000 acre property ("RV Project") in Railroad Valley...'

coverage_area_unit.justification: The unit for the coverage area is specified in the text: '...it has acquired a prospective 1,000 acre property ("RV Project") in Railroad Valley...'

resource_size.justification: The text indicates the project is early-stage and lacks a defined resource: 'Despite its promising geologic similarities to Clayton Valley, Railroad Valley remains largely underexplored for lithium and boron.'

buyer_ticker_and_exchange.justification: The authoritative metadata provided (TSXV: PE) corresponds to Pure Energy Minerals Ltd., the buyer in a separate transaction also in Railroad Valley. The correct buyer for the project of interest is Canter Resources Corp., whose ticker is explicitly stated as '(CSE: CRC)' in the text.
